definition_en: To plan and carry out (a picture, work of art, construction etc.).
example: I'm designing a new logo for my company. / 私は、会社の新しいロゴを設計しています。

definition_en: Something small enough to escape casual notice.
example: The architect focused on the details of the building's design. / 建築家は建物のデザインの細部に焦点を当てた。

definition_en: To set the boundaries or limits of.
meanings_ja: 構築する (in a logical or mathematical sense)
example: I need to determine what gift to get my friend / 私は友達に贈るgiftを決める必要があります

definition_en: The process of developing; growth, directed change.
example: The company's development of new products led to increased profits. / その会社の新製品開発は増収をもたらした。

definition_en: Any piece of equipment made for a particular purpose, especially a mechanical or electrical one.
meanings_ja: 装置、機器 (in this sense, it refers to electronic or mechanical devices)
example: The company developed new devices to improve efficiency. / その会社、新しい導具を開発して効率を改善した。

definition_en: A plan, drawing, sketch or outline to show how something works, or show the relationships between the parts of a whole.
example: The teacher drew a diagram to explain the concept of gravity. / 教師は重力の概念を説明するために図示した。

definition_en: (manner) In a different way.
example: I like to learn things differently from my friends. / 私は友達のように異なった方法で学びます。

definition_en: Not to have the same traits or characteristics; to be unalike or distinct.
example: The two companies differ in their approach to marketing. / 两家公司的marketing策略不同。

definition_en: To manage, control, steer.
example: The company will direct its resources to developing new products. / 会社は新しい製品の開発に資源を向ける。

definition_en: To manage, control, steer.
example: The movie was directed by a famous filmmaker. / 映画は有名な映画監督によって製作された。

definition_en: To converse or debate concerning a particular topic.
meanings_ja: 議論された、話し合われた
example: The new policy was discussed and approved by the board. / 新しい政策はボードが話し合い、承認されました。

definition_en: To converse or debate concerning a particular topic.
An abnormal condition of a human, animal or plant that causes discomfort or dysfunction; distinct from injury insofar as the latter is usually instantaneously acquired.
example: The doctor diagnosed me with a disease. / 医者は私の病気を診断した。

definition_en: Feeling or displaying disappointment or a lack of contentment.
example: I'm dissatisfied with the service. / 私はサービスに満足していない。

definition_en: A doctor.
example: The doctor examined my injury. / 医師は私の傷を検診した。

definition_en: An original or official paper used as the basis, proof, or support of anything else, including any writing, book, or other instrument conveying information pertinent to such proof or support.
meanings_ja: 記録、証拠 (in formal or official contexts)
example: The company has a vast collection of documents related to its history. / その会社は歴史に関する膨大な文書を保管している。

definition_en: To move or develop something.
example: The artist was drawn to the beautiful scenery. / アーティストは素晴らしい景色に描き物された。

definition_en: At a time in advance of the usual or expected event.
example: The earliest flight to Tokyo was delayed. / トーキョー行きの一番古い飛行が遅れた。

definition_en: Pertaining to an economy.
example: The company's economic growth was affected by the global crisis. / その会社の経済成長はグローバル危機に影響された。

definition_en: Effective management of a community or system, or especially its resources.
example: The government is trying to boost the economy by cutting taxes. / 政府が税金を減らすことで経済を拡大することを目指している。

definition_en: A change to the text of a document.
meanings_ja: 映画や映像の編集を行う
example: The editor spent hours editing the script. / エディターは、スクリプトの編集に数時間費やした。

definition_en: To change a text, or a document.
example: I need to do some editing on this document before submitting it. / これらのドキュメントを提出する前にコピーの校正が必要です。

definition_en: A person who edits or makes changes to documents.
example: The editor reviewed the manuscript carefully. / 記者は詳細にマンスクリプトを検討しました。

definition_en: In an efficient or effective manner; with powerful effect.
example: She handled the project effectively, and it was completed on time. / 彼女はプロジェクトをちゃんと取り扱い、期日には完了した。

definition_en: A cause; something that causes an effect
meanings_ja: 能力があり、時間を節約する
example: The new manufacturing process is efficient and reduces production time. / 新しい製造プロセスは効率的で、生産時間を削減しています。

definition_en: One of the simplest or essential parts or principles of which anything consists, or upon which the constitution or fundamental powers of anything are based.
example: The periodic table lists all known elements. / 表紙にはすべての化学元素がリストされている。

definition_en: An individual who provides labor to a company or another person.
example: The company hired 100 new employees. / コングロマーシャルは100人の新しい社員を雇った。

definition_en: To make somebody able (to do, or to be, something); to give sufficient ability or power to do or to be; to give strength or ability to.
meanings_ja: 機能させる, 有効にする
example: The new software will enable users to access the database. / 新しいソフトウェアは、ユーザーがデータベースにアクセスできるようにします。

definition_en: A meeting, especially one that is unplanned or unexpected.
example: I had a weird encounter with a stranger yesterday. /昨日、奇妙な人間と出会った。

definition_en: To mentally support; to motivate, give courage, hope or spirit.
example: The teacher's encouraging words helped me feel more confident. / 教師の助成的な言葉に助けられて、私はより自信を持った。

definition_en: (heading) To interact socially.
meanings_ja: 弁護士に依頼されている (in a legal sense)
example: She was engaged to be married next year. / 彼女は来年の結婚式に向けて婚約中です。

definition_en: To design, construct or manage something as an engineer.
example: The company invested heavily in engineering research to develop a new product. / その会社は新製品の開発に大きく投資した。

definition_en: A person who is qualified or professionally engaged in any branch of engineering.
meanings_ja: 導師、技術的解決策の開発者
example: The company hired many engineers to develop a new product. / 会社は新製品を開発するために多くの技術者を雇用した。

definition_en: To make a pledge to (someone); to promise, guarantee (someone of something); to assure.
meanings_ja: 確認する (in a situation where you can't be 100% sure, but take steps to minimize the risk)
example: I will ensure that all files are backed up before the server is shut down. / サーバーを閉じる前には、すべてのファイルがバックアップされるように 確保する。

definition_en: Possession by a god; divine inspiration or frenzy.
example: She showed great enthusiasm for the new project. / 彼女は新プロジェクトに対して大きな熱意を示した。

definition_en: The whole of something; the entirety.
example: The entire team worked together to solve the problem. / その全チームは一緒に問題を解決した。

definition_en: The surroundings of, and influences on, a particular item of interest.
example: The company is committed to creating a healthy work environment. / 会社は健康的な仕事の環境を目指しています。

definition_en: The collective property and liabilities of someone, especially a deceased person.
example: She worked on her family's estate for many years. /彼女は多くの年間、家族の宿直木で働いた。

definition_en: In the end; at some later time, especially after a long time, a series of problems, struggles, delays or setbacks.
example: I'll finish my project eventually. / 私は最後にプロジェクトを完了する。

definition_en: Facts or observations presented in support of an assertion.
example: The police collected evidence at the crime scene. / 警察は事故現場で証拠を集めました。

definition_en: (stative) to be; have existence; have being or reality
example: The company existed before I was born. / その会社は私が生まれる前には有っていた。

definition_en: (stative) to be; have existence; have being or reality
example: The existing building needs to be renovated. / 既存の建物は改築が必要です。

definition_en: To predict or believe that something will happen
example: She expects a big reaction from her friends. / 彼女は友達から大きな反応を希望する。

definition_en: The effect upon the judgment or feelings produced by any event, whether witnessed or participated in; personal and direct impressions as contrasted with description or fancies; personal acquaintance; actual enjoyment or suffering.
example: I had many experiences traveling abroad. / 私は国外旅行での体験が多かった。

definition_en: A test under controlled conditions made to either demonstrate a known truth, examine the validity of a hypothesis, or determine the efficacy of something previously untried.
example: I'm going to conduct an experiment to see if this idea works. / 私はこのアイデアが実現するかどうかを実験します。

definition_en: To make plain, manifest, or intelligible; to clear of obscurity; to illustrate the meaning of.
example: The teacher explains the math problem on the blackboard. / 教師は黒板に数学の問題を説明します。

definition_en: To seek for something or after someone.
meanings_ja: 探検した (for exploration in the sense of searching or investigating)
example: The team explored the new territory, finding several hidden caves. / チームは新しい土地を探検し、数ヶ所の隠れ蔵を発見した。

definition_en: A range of values or locations.
example: The company's extent of services surprised me. / 私を驚かせた彼らのサービス範囲。

definition_en: (degree) To an extreme degree.
example: The weather was extremely hot yesterday. / Yesterday's weather was very hot indeed.

definition_en: A doer, maker; a person who does things for another person or organization.
example: The quality of the materials was a major factor in the product's success. / 材料の質が製品の成功の主要な原因であった。

definition_en: (manner) In a fair manner; fair; not biased or skewed or favouring a certain party
example: The weather was fairly nice yesterday. /昨日はなかなかいい天気だった。

definition_en: An attendant spirit, often in animal or demon form.
example: The hotel room was familiar to me from my previous stay. / ホテルの部屋は私が前回泊まったと同じ感じでした。

definition_en: A defect; something that detracts from perfection.
meanings_ja: 欠点、缺点 (in a broader sense)
example: The company's fault was ignoring customer complaints. / その会社の誤りは、顧客の苦情を無視したことだった。

definition_en: A defect; something that detracts from perfection.
example: The new software has several faults that need to be fixed. / 新しいソフトウェアにはいくつかの不足点があり修正が必要です。

definition_en: One's structure or make-up: form, shape, bodily proportions.
meanings_ja: 製品の性能 (in this case, "features" refers to a product's specifications or capabilities)
example: The new smartphone has many features that make it stand out from the competition. / 新しいスマートフォンには競争相手とは異なる多くの機能があります。

definition_en: Critical assessment of a process or activity or of their results.
meanings_ja: 評価のフィードバック
example: The company values customer feedback to improve its products. / その会社は、製品を改善するために顧客の評価に大いなる値を置いている。

definition_en: To contend in physical conflict, either singly or in war, battle etc.
example: The two countries are still fighting over the border. / 二国はまだ国境問題で対立中です。

definition_en: A drawing or diagram conveying information.
meanings_ja: 数字 (numbers), 計算結果 (results of calculation)
example: The company's financial figures show a significant increase in profits. / その会社の財務は利益が著しく増加している。

definition_en: To encounter or discover by accident; to happen upon.
example: I've made a finding that this new method is more efficient. / 私はこの新しい方法がより効率的であることを発見した。

definition_en: A repair or corrective action.
meanings_ja: 定着させる (to establish or secure)
example: I need to fix this broken phone. / この壊れた電話を修理したい。

definition_en: To pierce; now generally replaced by transfix.
meanings_ja: 修復された (for example, fixed a broken machine)
example: The cost of the repair is fixed at $100. / 維持費は$100で固定されている。

definition_en: A movement in people or things with a particular way in large numbers or amounts
example: The river flows gently through the valley. /ervalley

definition_en: A point at which reflected or refracted rays of light converge.
example: The company will focus on increasing sales this quarter. / その会社はこの四半期に売り上げを増やすことを目指す。

definition_en: (followed by on or upon) To concentrate one's attention.
meanings_ja: 目的のために集中した
精度の高い、特定の目標に向かって努力する
example: I need to stay focused on my work. / 僕は仕事に集中しておく必要があります。

definition_en: To violate (a woman); to rape.
example: The company was forced to lay off many employees due to financial difficulties. / 会社は財政状況のため多くの従業員を強い休職させる羽目になりました。

definition_en: In a fortunate manner.
meanings_ja: しかし、その結果は（幸運）
example: I was fortunate to get the job. / 僕が仕事をゲットしたのは lucky でした。

definition_en: The act of founding, fixing, establishing, or beginning to erect.
example: The foundation of her success was hard work. / 彼女の成功のはる難しい努力によるものです。

definition_en: To start (an institution or organization).
example: The company was founded by John Smith. / スミス社長によって創立された。

definition_en: A part of a whole, especially a comparatively small part.
example: The company will be divided into fractions of 10 employees each. / 社内は10人ずつに分けられます。

definition_en: The structural elements of a building or other constructed object.
meanings_ja: フレーム（写真のフレーム）
example: I'd like to put a frame around this picture. / 私はこの絵にフレームを付けて欲しいです。

definition_en: The structural elements of a building or other constructed object.
meanings_ja: フレーム（写真などのフレーム）
枠組み（建築などでのフレーム）
example: The company produces frames for digital cameras. / その会社はデジタルカメラのフレームを製造しています。

definition_en: To disappoint or defeat; to vex by depriving of something expected or desired.
example: I find it frustrating to deal with these bureaucratic rules. / これらの官僚的なルールを扱うと、私は非常に気に障る。

definition_en: In a full manner; without lack or defect.
example: I'm fully prepared for the exam. / 私は試験に対して完全に準備しています。

definition_en: What something does or is used for.
example: The function of a manager is to make sure the company runs smoothly. / CEOは会社を滑らかに運営することを目指す。

definition_en: The time ahead; those moments yet to be experienced.
example: The company invested in futures contracts to hedge against price fluctuations. / その会社は価格変動に対処するために将来の株式取引に投資した。

definition_en: Popularly or widely.
example: I generally prefer to stay at home on weekends. /私は週末は大半家で過ごす。

definition_en: A globally scoped identifier.
meanings_ja: 総合的な, 普遍的な
example: The company is going global with its new marketing strategy. / その会社は新しいマーケティングストラテジーを通じて世界的に展開します。

definition_en: To assign scores to the components of an academic test.
meanings_ja: 評価尺度 (in academic or educational contexts)
example: The company uses a grading system to evaluate employee performance. / 会社は社員のパフォーマンスを評価するための格付けシステムを使用しています。

definition_en: Having greed; consumed by selfish desires.
example: He's always looking for ways to get more, but his greedy nature has hurt others. / 彼は常に更多を探し続けているが、貪欲的な性格が他人に害を及ぼしている。

definition_en: An increase in size, number, value, or strength.
meanings_ja: 増加 (in a physical or numerical sense)
example: The company's growth led to new job opportunities. / その会社の発展により、新しい仕事ができた。

definition_en: One who helps; an aide.
example: She was a big helper at the community center. / 彼女はコミュニティセンターで大きな役割を果たした。

definition_en: Payment for the temporary use of something.
meanings_ja: 賃金を払う (rental serviceの場合)
example: The company hires new employees every year. / 会社は毎年新しい従業員を雇用します。

definition_en: Someone who is hoping for success or victory, especially as a candidate in a political election.
example: She was a hopeful candidate for the election. / は、選挙に有望の候補者であった。

definition_en: In a hopeful manner.
example: I'll try to finish the project hopefully, but it's still uncertain. / 私はプロジェクトを完了することを望むが、未だ不明な点がある。

definition_en: In an immediate manner; instantly or without delay.
example: I'll call you immediately after I finish this meeting. / 私は、この会議終了後すぐに電話をかけます。

definition_en: To affect (someone) strongly and often favourably.
example: I was impressed by her performance. / 彼女のパフォーマンスに印象深く感じた。

definition_en: To make (something) better; to increase the value or productivity (of something).
meanings_ja: mejoruited (in a specific context, e.g. technical improvement)
example: The new software has improved performance and reliability. / 新しいソフトウェアは性能や信頼性がくれている。

definition_en: The act of improving; advancement or growth; a bettering
example: The company made significant improvements in their manufacturing process. / その会社は製造工程に大きな改良を施しました。

definition_en: An amount by which a quantity is increased.
meanings_ja: 吐出する（金融での増加）
example: The company's profits will increase next quarter. / 来Quarterには利益が増加する。

definition_en: (of a quantity, etc.) To become larger or greater.
example: The company's profits have increased over the past year. / 企業の利益は過去一年間増加している。

definition_en: An amount by which a quantity is increased.
example: The company's profits increases every year. / その会社の利益は毎年増加している。

definition_en: (of a quantity, etc.) To become larger or greater.
example: The company's profits are increasing. / その企業の利益は増加しています。

definition_en: Increasing in amount or intensity
example: The company is increasingly focusing on sustainable practices. / 会社はますます持続可能な実践に焦点を当てています。

definition_en: Too implausible to be credible; beyond belief; unbelievable.
example: The new roller coaster is incredible! / 新しいローラーコースターは信じられない！

definition_en: A person considered alone, rather than as belonging to a group of people.
example: The company values its individual employees' skills. / その会社は個々の社員の能力を大切にしている。

definition_en: The tendency to work persistently. Diligence.
example: The company is a major player in the industry. / その会社は業界で主要な存在です。

definition_en: To instruct, train (usually in matters of knowledge).
example: The company informed us about the new policy. / 会社は新しいポリシーについて知らせてありました。

definition_en: One of the substances present in a mixture, especially food.
example: The recipe requires several ingredients to make a delicious cake. / これらの調合物を組み合わせることで、美味しいケーキを作れる。

definition_en: To examine critically or carefully; especially, to search out problems or determine condition; to scrutinize.
example: The quality control team inspects all products before shipping. / その品を出荷する前には、品質管理チームが全ての製品を検査する。

definition_en: A person employed to inspect something.
example: The government inspector ensured that all safety regulations were followed. / 政府の檢査官は、安全規則が遵守されたことを確保しました。

definition_en: A very short period of time; a moment.
meanings_ja: 即座の,即ち (in a digital or technical context)
example: I need instant coffee to wake me up. / 私は、目覚めるために即座コーヒーが必要です。

definition_en: The act of instructing, teaching, or furnishing with information or knowledge.
example: The instruction manual was unclear. / 記述の説明書は曖昧だった。

definition_en: To explain or tell the meaning of; to translate orally into intelligible or familiar language or terms. applied especially to language, but also to dreams, signs, conduct, mysteries, etc.
example: The teacher asked students to interpret the poem. / 教師は生徒たちに詩を解釈することを依頼した。

definition_en: One who conveys what a user of one language is saying or signing, in real time or shortly after that person has finished communicating, to a user of a different language. (Contrasted with a translator.)
example: The interpreter helped us communicate with the foreign visitors. / 外国人とのコミュニケーションを助けた説明者。

definition_en: To ask questions of (somebody); to have an interview.
example: She was interviewed by a famous journalist. / 彼女は有名なジャーナリストにインタビューされた。

definition_en: To design a new process or mechanism.
meanings_ja: 創造的に考えること (創意工夫)
example: The company is always inventing new products. / その会社は常に新しい製品を開発している。

definition_en: To roll or fold up; to wind round; to entwine.
example: The company was involved in a scandal. / 会社はスキャンダルに絡んでいた。

definition_en: To roll or fold up; to wind round; to entwine.
meanings_ja: 関係がある、関係性を持つ (includes)
example: The new policy involves significant changes to our company's operations. / その新しい政策は、私企業の運営に大きな変更を含む。

definition_en: In a widespread or large manner.
example: The new policy is largely responsible for the company's success. / その新しい政策は、その会社の成功の主たる要因です。

definition_en: A single thickness of some material covering a surface.
example: The new software has multiple layers of security. / 新しいソフトウェアは複数のセキュリティー層を持つ。

definition_en: A single thickness of some material covering a surface.
meanings_ja: レイヤー構造 (in computing and networking)
example: The company's marketing strategy consists of multiple layers to reach its target audience. / その会社のマーケティング戦略は、ターゲットアウディエンスに向けた複数の層を持っています。

definition_en: A heavy, pliable, inelastic metal element, having a bright, bluish color, but easily tarnished; both malleable and ductile, though with little tenacity. It is easily fusible, forms alloys with other metals, and is an ingredient of solder and type metal. Atomic number 82, symbol Pb (from Latin plumbum).
example: The new technology leads to improved efficiency. / 新技術導くことで効率が改善される。

definition_en: To allow to, not to prevent (+ infinitive, but usually without to).
meanings_ja: 許容する (allowing), 余裕がある (having time and energy)
example: I'm letting my kids play outside until it's dark. / 家庭は晩まで子供たちに外に出しを許しています。

definition_en: Word for word; not figuratively; not as an idiom or metaphor
meanings_ja: veroで、明確に (for "verbal irony" or sarcasm)
example: I'm literally starving! / 私は実際に飢えている！

definition_en: Lines
meanings_ja: 音楽記号 (in music notation, "ll" is often used to indicate a tie or a repeated note)
example: The sequence ll... will continue indefinitely. / そのつづきは限りなく続く。

definition_en: The trunk of a dead tree, cleared of branches.
meanings_ja: 記録データ、ログファイル
example: The company logs all customer interactions. / 会社は全ての顧客相談をログに記録します。

definition_en: A method of human thought that involves thinking in a linear, step-by-step manner about how a problem can be solved. Logic is the basis of many principles including the scientific method.
example: The company's decision was based on logic, not emotions. / 会社の決断は理由で、感情ではなかった。

definition_en: Forcefully, vigorously.
example: The book was mainly about space exploration. / 宇宙探査についての本だった。

definition_en: To support (someone), to back up or assist (someone) in an action.
example: The company will maintain its quality standards. / 会社は品質の基準を維持します。

definition_en: Administration; the use of limited resources combined with forecasting, planning, leadership and execution skills to achieve predetermined specific goals.
example: The company's management team implemented a new strategy. / その会社の企画チームは新しい戦略を実施した。

definition_en: Having meaning, significant.
meanings_ja: 示す、伝える (in this sense, meaningful refers to something that conveys a message or has significance)
example: This experience was truly meaningful. / この経験はとても大切なものだった。

definition_en: A prescribed quantity or extent.
example: The company took measures to reduce energy consumption. / 会社はエネルギー消費を減らすために手段を取った。

definition_en: One who brings messages.
example: The messenger delivered the important documents. / 証人が重要な文書を配達した。

definition_en: A set of tasks that fulfills a purpose or duty; an assignment set by an employer, or by oneself.
example: NASA's mission is to explore space. / NASAの任務は宇宙を探査する。

definition_en: A mixture of water and soil or fine grained sediment.
example: The kids loved playing in the muddy puddle. / 子供たちは浸かった池に遊んだ。

definition_en: (ditransitive) To give a name to.
example: The company is naming its new product "EcoCycle" to emphasize its environmental benefits. / その会社は「エコサイクル」という名前を付けて環境的なbenefitsを強調しています。

definition_en: (chiefly in the plural) A narrow passage, especially a contracted part of a stream, lake, or sea; a strait connecting two bodies of water.
example: The road was very narrow, but we had to drive through. / 道は非常に小さくて、車を通らなければならなかった。

definition_en: Inevitably; of necessity.
example: It is necessarily true that 2 + 2 = 4. / 実際には 2 + 2 = 4 が真である。

definition_en: To have an absolute requirement for.
example: I'm needing a break from work. / 僕は仕事から休みが欲しい。

meanings_ja: 捕網、ネットキャッチ (in sports or fishing)
example: The company uses a global network to communicate with clients. / コングローバルなネットワークを使用してクライアントとのコミュニケーションを行います。

definition_en: A mesh of string, cord or rope.
example: The fisherman uses a net to catch fish. / 魚は網で捕獲する。

definition_en: A fabric or structure of fibrous elements attached to each other at regular intervals.
meanings_ja: コミュニケーション網
example: The company's networks were compromised, resulting in a data breach. / その企業のネットワークが破られたため、データ漏洩があった。

definition_en: To no extent, in no way.
example: The non-stick pan is easy to clean. / ノンスティックのフライパンは洗いやすい。

meanings_ja: ネット・スタティック
ナチュラルシミュレーション (in scientific or technical contexts)
example: The company uses NS to provide cloud services. / その会社は NS を使ってクラウドサービスの提供を行う。

definition_en: The act of objecting.
example: The company received several objections from customers about the new policy. / その会社は、新しい政策に対する多くの反対意見を受けました。

definition_en: The act of observing, and the fact of being observed (see observance)
example: The scientist made an observation about the behavior of the animal. / 科学者は動物の行動について観察を行った。

definition_en: To notice or view, especially carefully or with attention to detail.
meanings_ja: 察知する (to notice or be aware of something)
example: We will observe the behavior of animals in their natural habitat. / 自然の生態系で動物の行動を目撃します。

definition_en: Easily discovered, seen, or understood; self-explanatory.
meanings_ja: 示唆的, はっきりと
example: It was obvious that she was tired. / 彼女が疲れていたことは明白だった。

definition_en: In an obvious or clearly apparent manner.
example: It's obviously too cold to go swimming. / それは明らかに泳げない寒さです。

definition_en: A subjective belief, judgment or perspective that a person has formed about a topic, issue, person or thing.
example: I value your opinion. / 私はあなたの考えを尊重します。

definition_en: The quality of being organized.
example: The charity organization helped to distribute food and medicine to the affected areas. / 地区に食糧や医療品を配布したために慈善組織が役立った。

definition_en: As it was in the beginning.
example: The company was originally founded in 1990. / その会社は元来1990年に設立された。

definition_en: Other than supposed; different.
example: If it's sunny, we'll go to the beach; otherwise, we'll stay home. / 晴れがある場合はビーチに行く；そういう場合は家でいてしまう。

definition_en: A garment worn over other clothing to protect it; a coverall or boiler suit. A garment, for manual labor or for casual wear, often made of a single piece of fabric, with long legs and a bib upper, supported from the shoulders with straps, and having several large pockets and loops for carrying tools.
example: The company's overall performance was impressive this year. / その会社の一般的パフォーマンスは、この年非常に印象的でした。

definition_en: To have rightful possession of (property, goods or capital); to have legal title to.
example: The company owned by John was successful. / ジョンの所有する会社は成功した。

definition_en: A small individual part of something larger; a detail, a point.
meanings_ja: 特殊な (shuseki na) - referring to something that is unique or distinct
詳細の (teikei no) - relating to specific details or facts
example: The company has a particular process for developing new products. / その会社は、新製品開発に特殊なプロセスを持つ。

definition_en: (focus) Especially, extremely.
example: I'm particularly interested in Japanese culture. / 私は日本文化に特に興味があります。

definition_en: In part, or to some degree, but not completely.
example: The new policy will be partly effective from next year. / 新しい政策は、来年の半ばより部分的に実施されます。

definition_en: A trail for the use of, or worn by, pedestrians.
example: The company will follow new paths to increase its revenue. / その会社は新しい道を歩みながら収入を増やすつもりです。

definition_en: The act of paying.
example: The company requires monthly payments from its customers. / その会社は月々の支払いを顧客から要します。

definition_en: An advertisement by which individuals attempt to meet others with similar interests.
example: My personal experience was very helpful. / 私の個人的経験はとても役に立った。

definition_en: In a poor manner or condition; without plenty, or sufficiency, or suitable provision for comfort.
example: The patient was recovering poorly from the surgery. / 外科手術から回復が悪くてした。

definition_en: The quality of being possible.
meanings_ja: 簡単な解釈ではありえないが、可能性があると考える
example: There is a possibility that I will miss the meeting. / 会議を掛かる可能性があります。

definition_en: (modifying a clause or predicate) Perhaps; indicates that the proposition may be true (is not certainly false) regardless of any facts or circumstances known to, stated by or implied by the speaker.
example: It's possibly raining tomorrow. / 明日は雨が降るかもしれない。

definition_en: Currently unrealized ability (with the most common adposition being to)
example: The company has great potential to expand globally. / その会社はグローバルに拡大する可能性があります。

definition_en: A part of an exam or series of exams in which the candidate has to demonstrate their practical ability
example: The new smartphone is very practical, perfect for everyday use. / 新しいスマートフォンは非常に実用的で、日常生活に向いています。

definition_en: A prediction.
example: The weather forecaster predicted a storm would hit tomorrow. / その天気予報は明日嵐が来ることを予測した。

definition_en: To make a prediction: to forecast, foretell, or estimate a future event on the basis of knowledge and reasoning; to prophesy a future event on the basis of mystical knowledge or power.
example: The weather forecast predicted a storm tomorrow. / 明日は嵐が降るという予報があった。

definition_en: A statement of what will happen in the future.
example: The weather forecast said it would rain, but my predictions were different. / 我が予測は異なり、雨の予報ではなかった。

definition_en: A fundamental assumption or guiding belief.
example: The company's principle of fairness is admirable. / その会社の公平性原則は尊敬すべきです。

definition_en: To move, pass, or go forward or onward; to advance; to carry on
meanings_ja: 取り組む (in a more formal or business-like context)
example: I will proceed with the project. / 私はプロジェクトをすすめる。

definition_en: A series of events which produce a result (the product).
meanings_ja: プロセス (in a computer or software context)
example: The company has a thorough process for reviewing job applications. / その会社は、仕事の申し込みを検討するために徹底的な手続きを持っています。

definition_en: To yield, make or manufacture; to generate.
example: The company is producing high-quality electronics. / その会社は高品質な電子製品を生産しています。

definition_en: The act of producing, making or creating something.
example: The company's main production was halted due to a power outage. / コンパニーのメインの造作はパワーオウトが止まりました。

definition_en: Capable of producing something, especially in abundance; fertile.
meanings_ja: 生成的 (in scientific or technical contexts)
example: The new employee has been very productive since joining the team. / 新入社員はチームに加わって以来非常に有効的に働いています。

definition_en: A person who belongs to a profession
example: As a professional musician, he has been touring around the world. / プロフェッショナルなミュージシャンとして世界を回り旅しています。

definition_en: One who writes computer programs; a software developer.
meanings_ja: パソコンプログラムの専門家
example: John is a talented programmer who created a popular video game. / ジョンは人気のビデオゲームを作った才能あるプログラマーです。

definition_en: One who writes computer programs; a software developer.
example: The company hired several programmers to develop a new software. / その会社は新しいソフトウェアの開発に複数のプログラマを雇った。

definition_en: To enter a program or other instructions into (a computer or other electronic device) to instruct it to do a particular task.
meanings_ja: コンピュータプログラミング
課程、スケジュール設定
example: I'm studying programming in college. / 私は大学でコンピュータプログラミングを学んでいる。

definition_en: Movement or advancement through a series of events, or points in time; development through time.
example: The new technology has made great progress in the field of medicine. / 医療分野で新しい技術が大きな進歩を遂げている。

definition_en: A planned endeavor, usually with a specific goal and accomplished in several steps or stages.
example: I'm working on a project to develop a new software. / 新ソフトウェアの開発を目指して仕事しています。

definition_en: A planned endeavor, usually with a specific goal and accomplished in several steps or stages.
example: We're working on several projects to improve our company's image. / 私たちは会社のイメージを向上させるための複数のプロジェクトに取り組んでいます。

definition_en: Something set apart for a special use.
example: This is a proper way to do it. / これは適切な方法です。

definition_en: In public, openly, in an open and public manner.
example: The company will publicly announce its new policy. / その会社は新しい政策を一般に発表します。

definition_en: To issue (something, such as printed work) for distribution and/or sale.
example: The company will publish a new book next month. / その会社は来月新しい書籍を出版します。

definition_en: To issue (something, such as printed work) for distribution and/or sale.
example: The company published its quarterly report. / 会社は四半期報告書を公表しました。

definition_en: Level of excellence.
meanings_ja: 優秀さ, 優れた状態
example: The company is known for its high quality products. / その会社は優秀な製品に知られます。

definition_en: A quotation; a statement attributed to a person.
example: The company quoted a price of $1000. / その会社は 1000 ドルで価格を示しました。

definition_en: With speed; in a rapid manner.
example: The company is expanding rapidly. / 会社は急速に拡大しています。

definition_en: The worth of something; value.
example: The hotel rates were very high. / ホテルの料金は非常に高かった。

definition_en: An emoji used to express a reaction to a post on social media.
meanings_ja: 付け加える、反映させる
example: When I see her smile, my heart reacts with warmth. / 彼女の笑顔を見るに、私は暖かい感情で反応する。

definition_en: To make real; to convert from the imaginary or fictitious into reality; to bring into real existence
example: I finally realized my dream was impossible. / 私の夢が不可能であることをようやく実感した。

definition_en: To bend back (light, etc.) from a surface.
example: She spent hours reflecting on her past mistakes. / 彼女は数時間、過去の間違いについて考えた。

definition_en: Connection or association; the condition of being related.
meanings_ja: 関係、連携 (in a broader sense, referring to connections or interactions between things)
example: I value my relationship with my best friend. / 私は、最良の友人との人間関係を大切に思います。

definition_en: Someone in the same family; someone connected by blood, marriage, or adoption.
example: My sister is my relative. / 私の姉は私の血筋関係です。

definition_en: Proportionally, in relation to some larger scale thing.
example: The weather is relatively mild this time of year. / 今シーズンは比較的暖かいです。

definition_en: Something or someone reliable or dependable
example: The company is reliable, so I trust them with my project. / その会社は信頼できるため、私のプロジェクトを彼らに任せる。

definition_en: To restore to a former place, position, condition, etc.; to put back
meanings_ja: スタンダードに置き換える
スタイルや風貌を新しくする
すでに存在するものを更新する
example: I need to replace my old laptop with a new one. / 新しいノートパソコンに置き換えなければ

definition_en: To present again or anew; to present by means of something standing in the place of; to exhibit the counterpart or image of; to typify.
meanings_ja: 代理された (in a formal or official capacity)
example: The company was represented by its CEO at the meeting. / 会社はCEOが会議に代わって出席しました。

definition_en: What somebody is known for.
example: The company's good reputation has helped them attract new customers. / その会社の良好な評判は新たな顧客を引きつけてきた。

definition_en: An attitude of consideration or high regard
example: She showed great respect to her elders. / 彼女は敬意を示し、先輩に尊敬した。

definition_en: The individual who bears the responsibility for something.
example: As a team leader, it is my responsible to ensure the project's success. / プロジェクトの成功を保証する責任が私の役割です。

definition_en: To restrain within boundaries; to limit; to confine
meanings_ja: 限定された (in certain contexts, such as restricted access or restricted hours)
example: The hotel rooms were restricted to guests only. / ホテルの部屋はゲスト限定でした。

definition_en: To take back possession of (something).
example: I need to update my resume before applying for the job. / 私は-jobの申請前、私の就職の履歴書を更新する必要があります。

definition_en: A political upheaval in a government or nation state characterized by great change.
example: The French Revolution changed the course of history. / フランス革命は歴史の流れを変えた。

definition_en: The act of writing again or anew.
example: I need to rewrite this essay. / 私はこのエッセイを再度書く必要があります。

definition_en: Wealthy: having a lot of money and possessions.
example: He's the richest person in this country. / 彼はこの国の最高額の人物です。

definition_en: To move, or appear to move, physically upwards relative to the ground.
example: The temperature will rise if we turn up the heat. / 温度は熱を上げると高くなる。

definition_en: A machine built to carry out some complex task or group of tasks by physically moving, especially one which can be programmed.
meanings_ja: ロボット（機械的な人形）
自動化装置、工業ロボット
example: The robots were designed to perform repetitive tasks. / 自動化ロボットは繰り返し仕事を行うように設計された。

definition_en: A ladder; a series of steps; a means of ascending.
example: The artist worked on a large scale to create the mural. / その巨大な壁画は大きい寸法で描かれた。

definition_en: A student; one who studies at school or college, typically having a scholarship.
meanings_ja: 研究家 (主に学術研究に従事する人物を指す)
example: The scholar spent years studying ancient civilizations. / 古代文明に関する研究で多くの年を費やした。

definition_en: A disruption, mark or shallow cut on a surface made by scratching.
meanings_ja: 傷つける、傷つけるとき
example: I scratched my name on the wall. / 私は壁に名前を掘りおぼれました。

definition_en: To look in (a place) for something.
example: I'm searching for a new job. / 私は新しい仕事を探しています。

definition_en: The operation of navigating through a stream.
example: I'm seeking a new job. / 私は新しい仕事を探しています。

definition_en: (ditransitive) To transfer goods or provide services in exchange for money.
example: The company is selling new products online. / 会社は、新製品をオンラインで売り出しています。

definition_en: Sensation; sensibility.
example: She made a sensible decision to quit her job. / 彼女は会社を辞める合理的な決断をした。

definition_en: In a separate manner; not together; apart.
meanings_ja: 独自に, riêngに (when referring to a specific context or nuance)
example: The company's financial reports were published separately from the annual report. / 会計報告は、年次報告とは別に発表された。

definition_en: The act of disuniting two or more things, or the condition of being separated.
example: The couple's separation was a shock to their friends. / 夫婦の人間関係の断絶は友人たちには衝撃だった。

definition_en: An act of being of assistance to someone.
meanings_ja: 企業や組織が提供する商品やサービス
技術的なサポートやメンテナンスなど、実際的な仕事
example: Our company provides a range of services to clients. / 私たちの会社はクライアントに対して多くのサービスを提供しています。

definition_en: (personal) To provide a service (or, by extension, a product, especially food or drink).
example: The waiter is serving us our meals. / ウェイターが私たちに食事を仕えている。

definition_en: To give part of what one has to somebody else to use or consume.
example: The company will shared the profits equally among its employees. / その会社は、社員たちに均等に利益を分かち合う。

definition_en: A modifier key whose main function is shifting between two or more functions of any of certain other keys (usually by pressing Shift and the other button simultaneously).
meanings_ja: ずれ、移転 (in a mechanical sense)
example: The company is going to shift its focus from manufacturing to software development. / 会社は製造からソフトウェア開発に集中することにします。

definition_en: To display, to have somebody see (something).
example: The company is showing a profit. / 会社は利益を表示しています。

definition_en: That which has significance; a sign; a token; a symbol.
example: The new policy will have a significant impact on our company's profits. / その新しいポリシーは、私企業の利益に大きな影響を与える。

definition_en: (manner) In a like style or manner.
example: I like playing tennis similarly to my friend. / 私は友達のようにテニスを好む。

definition_en: (grammar) A form of a word that refers to only one person or thing.
meanings_ja: 例外的な, 一番小さい
example: This is a singular experience. / これは個々の体験です。

definition_en: Having or showing skill; skillful.
example: He's a skilled programmer. / 彼はプログラミングが上手です。

definition_en: Slenderly; delicately.
example: The food was slightly spicy. / お料理はほどเผ็ดでした。

definition_en: Encoded computer instructions, usually modifiable (unless stored in some form of unalterable memory such as ROM).
meanings_ja: コンピュータープログラム
example: I need to update my software to use the new app. / 新しいアプリを使用するためには、ソフトウェアをアップデートする必要があります。

definition_en: Of or pertaining to the sun; proceeding from the sun
example: The solar panels generated electricity. / 太陽パネルは電気を生成した。

definition_en: A homogeneous mixture, which may be liquid, gas or solid, formed by dissolving one or more substances.
example: The company is looking for solutions to reduce energy consumption. / その会社はエネルギー消費削減のためのソリューションを探しています。

definition_en: More or less; a certain quantity or degree; a part, more or less; something.
example: I'm somewhat tired today. / 今日はちょっと疲れた。

definition_en: A general type.
example: What's your favorite sort of music? / お楽しみの音楽は何種ですか？

definition_en: A general type.
example: The company offers various sorts of products. / その会社は多種の製品を販売しています。

definition_en: The person, place or thing from which something (information, goods, etc.) comes or is acquired.
example: The company is the source of the innovative technology. / これらの新技術の原点はその会社です。

definition_en: A distinguishing attribute or quality.
meanings_ja: 定められた, 指定された
example: The company has specific requirements for new employees. / その会社は新入社員に対する具体的な要件を持つ。

definition_en: In a specific manner, applying to or naming a particular thing or things, expressly, explicitly
example: I will specifically focus on this project. / 私はこのプロジェクトについて特に焦点を置きます。

definition_en: Present participle of spend, expenditure.
meanings_ja: 過去に費やした時間や金銭
example: I'm worried about my spending habits. / 私の財布運営に心配しています。

definition_en: Rapid circular motion.
meanings_ja: 説得, 説明 (in a persuasive or convincing way)
example: The company is trying to spin their financial losses as a temporary setback. / その会社は経営損失を一時的な挫折として説明している。

definition_en: A building, wing or dependency set apart and adapted for lodging and feeding (and training) animals with hoofs, especially horses.
meanings_ja: 牛馬の飼育場 (in this sense, stable is a noun)
example: The horse was kept in a stable. / 馬は牧草地に置かれていた。

definition_en: (construed with at) To look fixedly (at something).
example: I was staring at the TV screen. / テレビスクリーンをじろめていた。

definition_en: A declaration or remark.
example: The company made a statement about its new product. / その会社は新製品について公式の声明を発表した。

definition_en: A declaration or remark.
example: The company issued a statement apologizing for the mistake. / その会社は誤りに対する公式の謝罪声明を出した。

definition_en: A mathematical science concerned with data collection, presentation, analysis, and interpretation.
example: The company uses statistics to analyze market trends. / その会社は市場トレンドを分析するために統計を使用しています。

definition_en: A store or supply.
example: The company has a strong stock of new employees. / その会社は新入社員の力強い力を持つ。

definition_en: The act of storing goods; the state of being stored.
example: The company uses cloud storage to backup its files. / その会社はクラウドヒットストレージを使用してファイルをバックアップしています。

definition_en: The science and art of military command as applied to the overall planning and conduct of warfare.
example: The company's new strategy was to focus on online marketing. / 会社はオンライン・マーケティングを中心とした新しい手法にした。

definition_en: An act of stretching.
meanings_ja: 距離や時間を延長する (e.g. stretch a deadline)
example: I need to stretch my schedule to finish this project. / 私のスケジュールを伸ばす必要があります。

definition_en: A building, wing or dependency set apart and adapted for lodging and feeding (and training) animals with hoofs, especially horses.
meanings_ja: 調整のために繋いだ関係
example: The company's success is a result of strong strings between its employees. / その会社の成功は、従業員たちの強い繋がりによるものです。

definition_en: A long, thin piece of land; any long, thin area.
meanings_ja: ストライプ (meaning a narrow band of color or pattern)
生き様 (meaning to remove or take off one's clothes)
example: I love her new striped dress. / 私は彼女の新しいストライプドレスを愛する。

definition_en: In a strong or powerful manner.
meanings_ja: 深く、熱心に (depending on the context)
example: I strongly believe in the power of education. / 私は教育の力に強く信じています。

definition_en: (sometimes with out or through) To delete or cross out; to scratch or eliminate.
meanings_ja: ぶつかる (physical contact) / うっかり忘れる (careless mistake)
example: The team was struck by the sudden change in weather. / チームは、急に変化した天気に驚かされた。

definition_en: To follow in order; to come next after; hence, to take the place of.
meanings_ja: 遂行された (in a meeting or event)
example: She succeeded in her business venture. / 彼女はビジネスベンチャーに成功した。

definition_en: To imply but stop short of saying explicitly.
example: The teacher's words were suggesting that we should work harder. / 教師の言葉は、私たちが更に努力することを示していた。

definition_en: Something suggested (with subsequent adposition being for)
example: The teacher gave us some suggestions on how to improve our presentation. / 教師は、パレントショーを改善するための提案を与えてくれた。

definition_en: To keep from falling.
meanings_ja: 補助された (in a financial or economic sense)
example: The company's new product was supported by a large marketing campaign. / その新製品は大規模なマーケティングキャンペーンで支えられた。

definition_en: To take for granted; to conclude, with less than absolute supporting data; to believe.
example: I suppose she's busy, so I'll call her later. / 彼女が忙しいと考えているため、後で電話をします。

definition_en: To take for granted; to conclude, with less than absolute supporting data; to believe.
example: The new policy is supposed to improve the company's image. / 新しい政策は企業のイメージを改善するため設定されている。

definition_en: In a way that causes surprise because it is unexpected, or unusual.
example: The new employee was surprisingly talented. / 新入社員はびっくりするほど才能がありました。

definition_en: Of a person, to continue to live; to remain alive.
meanings_ja: 生き残した (in a more casual or informal context)
example: The ship survived the storm. / 船は嵐を生き延びた。

definition_en: The act of suspecting something or someone, especially of something wrong.
example: The detective had a suspicion that the suspect was hiding something. / 偵察官は、容疑者が何か隠しているのを疑っていた。

definition_en: A collection of organized things; a whole composed of relationships among its members.
meanings_ja: 計算システム (computing systems), 生物系 (biological systems)
example: The company's new financial systems have improved efficiency. / その会社の新しい金融システムは効率を向上させました。

definition_en: A marked natural ability or skill.
example: She has a natural talent for music. / 彼女は音楽に対して天然の才能を持つ。

definition_en: Endowed with one or more talents.
example: She's a talented singer and songwriter. / 彼女は歌手兼作曲家として才能がある。

definition_en: A pickup truck with a gun mounted on it.
example: The technical manual is very detailed. / 技術マニュアルは非常に詳細です。

definition_en: The organization of knowledge for practical purposes.
meanings_ja: 手法、方法 (in a broader sense)
example: The company is investing heavily in new technologies to stay competitive. / その会社は競争力維持のため、新しい技術を大規模に投資しています。

definition_en: (Old English law) To make a tender of; to offer or tender.
meanings_ja: 指向する, 適応する (depending on context)
example: The company tends to hire people with experience. / その会社は経験のある人をhireする傾向がある。

definition_en: That which limits the extent of anything; limit, extremity, bound, boundary.
meanings_ja: 使用期限 (in computing or data storage)
example: The terms of the contract were not favorable to us. / 私達には契約の条件が不利だった。

definition_en: Terrifying, causing terror; terrible; sublime, awe-inspiring.
example: The fireworks display was terrific! / 火worksは非常に良かった！

definition_en: A description of an event or system that is considered to be accurate.
example: "He has developed several theories about the behavior of particles." / 「彼は粒子の挙動について複数の理論を開発した。」

definition_en: A unit of weight (mass) equal to 2240 pounds (a long ton) or 2000 pounds (a short ton) or 1000 kilograms (a metric ton).
example: The heavy ton of the iron ball was hard to lift. / 鉄のボールには重いトンの重さがあった。

definition_en: A mechanical device intended to make a task easier.
meanings_ja: 道具 (in a broader sense, e.g. in business or technology)
example: The company uses various tools to streamline its production process. / その会社は、生産プロセスを効率化するため、多種類のツールを使用しています。

definition_en: To make a journey
meanings_ja: スポーツやゲームの試合
example: I'm going touring in Europe this summer. /私は今夏ヨーロッパを車両で旅行します。

definition_en: An act of tracing.
example: The detective tried to follow the trace of blood to find the culprit. / 警察官は血痕を追跡して容疑者を捜索した。

definition_en: To practice an ability.
meanings_ja: 身体調整 (in sports or physical education)
example: I'm going to participate in a training program to improve my language skills. / 私は言語能力を向上させるためのトレーニングプログラムに参加します。

definition_en: The act of translating, in its various senses:
example: What's the translation of this article? / この記事の和訳は何ですか?

definition_en: The process or manner of treating someone or something.
example: The doctor explained various treatments for my condition. / 医者は、私の症状に対する多くの治療方法を説明した。

definition_en: (manner) In accordance with the facts; truthfully, accurately.
example: I truly love you. / 私はあなたを本当に愛しています。

definition_en: Confidence in or reliance on some person or quality.
example: I trust my friends with my secrets. / 私の友達に私の秘密を託す

definition_en: (sometimes proscribed) To tweet; to post an update to Twitter.
meanings_ja: SNS（ソーシャル・ニュース・サービス）
example: I love sharing my thoughts on Twitter. / Twitterで私の思想を共有しています。

meanings_ja: ファッションデザイナー
example: The famous fashion designer is named Tyler. / フェアモーのファッションデザイナーハイルンはタイラーと呼ばれています。

definition_en: In a typical or common manner.
example: The company typically operates 24/7. / その会社は、24時間365日営業です。

definition_en: To put text on paper using a typewriter.
example: I'm going to do some typing tonight. / 今夜はキーボードで文章を書きます。

definition_en: An expression used to show contentment for something
example: Person A: "I don't know what to do." Person B: "Um, have you tried asking someone else?" / 私は何をやろうか分からない。彼：ううん、誰かに尋ねるのではないか？

definition_en: To grasp a concept fully and thoroughly, especially (of words, statements, art, etc.) to be aware of the meaning of and (of people) to be aware of the intent of.
example: I gained a deeper understanding of her feelings. /彼女の気持ちをより深く理解した。

definition_en: Not expected, anticipated or foreseen.
example: The surprise party was unexpected. / そのサプライズパーティは予期せぬだった。

definition_en: Being the target of an action.
meanings_ja: 当時、時に (when referring to a specific time or occasion)
example: I'll give you the present upon your birthday. / ボクはあなたの誕生日にはプレゼントをあげます。

definition_en: Requiring immediate attention.
example: The doctor said it was an urgent case. / 医者は急病を述べた。

definition_en: The manner or the amount of using; use.
meanings_ja: 使用状況, 使用頻度
example: The new software has changed the usage of our old system. / 新しいソフトウェアは、旧システムの使用方法を変えた。

definition_en: One who uses or makes use of something, a consumer/client or an express or implied licensee (free user) or a trespasser.
example: The new smartphone app's user is very easy to navigate. / スマートフォンアプリケーションの使用者は非常に使いやすいです。

definition_en: One who uses or makes use of something, a consumer/client or an express or implied licensee (free user) or a trespasser.
example: The software is designed for end users. / ソフトウェアは最終的使用者向けに設計された。

definition_en: A personal possession such as jewellery, of relatively great monetary value; — usually used in plural form.
meanings_ja: 高価な (kakuba na) - valuable in terms of price or value
重要な (jouyou na) - having great importance or significance
example: The rare diamond is valuable. / those precious stones are kakuba na.

definition_en: The quality (positive or negative) that renders something desirable or valuable.
example: What are your values in life? / 人生の評価するものは何ですか？

definition_en: Having a broad range (of different elements).
example: The company offers various products. / その会社は多くの製品を提供しています。

definition_en: A vast space.
example: The vast desert stretched out before us. / 私たちは大きな砂漠に面した。

definition_en: A specific form or variation of something.
example: The new version of the software has improved functionality. / 新しいソフトウェア版は機能が改善されている。

definition_en: A specific form or variation of something.
example: The software has several versions for different operating systems. / ソフトウェアは異なるオペレーティングシステム向けに複数のバージョンがあります。

definition_en: An instance of having won a competition or battle or succeeded in an effort.
meanings_ja: 勝利 (in a broader sense, referring to a successful outcome or triumph)
example: We achieved victory in the election. / 我々は選挙で優勝した。

definition_en: Any element of something that depends on sight.
example: The company uses visual aids to present their new product. / その会社は、新製品を視覚的に発表する。

definition_en: (personal) Me and at least one other person; the objective case of we.
example: Apple vs. Google / アップルVSゴーグル

definition_en: Lacking in force (usually strength) or ability.
example: He's weaker than his brother. / 彼は弟より弱い。

definition_en: To determine the weight of an object.
example: I need to weigh the pros and cons before making a decision. / 決心する前には利点と短所を比較する必要があります。

definition_en: Fate; destiny; luck.
example: This new restaurant has a weird menu. / この新しいレストランには不思議なメニューがあります。

definition_en: A film, or some other dramatic work, set in, the historic (c. 1850-1910) American West (west of the Mississippi river) focusing on conflict between whites and Indians, lawmen and outlaws, ranchers and farmers, or industry (railroads, mining) and agriculture.
example: The cowboy rode his horse across the vast open range in the American Western. / アメリカ西部に馬を乗せ、開けた平野を横断した騎手

definition_en: (interrogative) Who ever: an emphatic form of who.
meanings_ja: いかなる者も (indicating uncertainty or ambiguity)
example: The reward goes to whoever solves this puzzle. / 賞は、このパズルの解法をした者には与えられます。

definition_en: In an unfair or immoral manner; unjustly.
example: I was wrongly accused of cheating. / 私は試験詐欺で誤った容疑に問われた。

definition_en: That part of a circle which a heavenly body appears to pass through as it moves above and below the horizon.
meanings_ja: 部分的な範囲 (for "partial arc" or a specific part of an arc)
example: The satellite followed an arc across the sky. / 衛星は空を見渡して円弧を描いた。

definition_en: The act of aspiring or ardently desiring; an ardent wish or desire, chiefly after what is elevated or spiritual (with common adjunct adpositions being to and of).
example: Her aspirations were to become a famous musician. / 彼女は有名なミュージシャンになることを目指していた。

definition_en: Of, or relating to hearing, or to the sense or organs of hearing
meanings_ja: 聞き覚えの (if referring to memory or recall)
example: The auditory system is responsible for processing sounds. / 音響系は音声を処理しています。

definition_en: To replace or enhance human labor with machines.
example: The company is automating its manufacturing process to improve efficiency. / その会社は生産プロセスを自動化して効率を高める。

definition_en: In a beneficial manner
example: The new policy will be implemented beneficially. / 新しいポリシーは有利に実施される。

definition_en: One who benefits or receives an advantage.
meanings_ja: 遺贈者の指定者 (in the context of wills and inheritances)
example: The foundation is the primary beneficiary of the company's donation. / その寄付を受け取るのは基金です。

definition_en: In a blissful, happy or joyful manner.
example: She blissfully unaware of the surprise party waiting for her. / 彼女は、その驚きのパーティーが待っていることに非常に幸福に無かった。

definition_en: To drive together, round up
meanings_ja: 勝つようなものがある
example: The new movie has a compelling storyline. / 新しい映画には強い印象を与えるストーリーがあります。

definition_en: To force physically, by strong persuasion or pressuring; to compel; to oblige.
example: The team was constrained by a tight budget. / チームは限定的な予算で困りました。

definition_en: To look at on all sides or in all its aspects; to view or consider with continued attention; to regard with deliberate care; to meditate on; to study, ponder, or consider.
meanings_ja: 想像する (in a more abstract or philosophical sense)
example: I like to contemplate the meaning of life. / 人生の意味を考えている。

definition_en: To look at on all sides or in all its aspects; to view or consider with continued attention; to regard with deliberate care; to meditate on; to study, ponder, or consider.
example: She contemplated a career change. / 彼女はキャリアチェンジを考えた。

definition_en: To contend.
example: The disputed territory was a contested issue at the peace talks. / 和平交渉では、領土の主張が激しく対立していた。
The company's continuationbased strategy led to its success. / その会社は、成功をもたらすために継続的な戦略をとった。

definition_en: Believable or plausible.
example: The scientist's research is credible, so we can trust her conclusions. / 科学者の研究は信頼できるため、彼女の結論を信じることができます。

definition_en: (of something seen or heard) Sharp, clearly defined.
example: The crispy lettuce was a refreshing change. / クリスピーのレタスは新鮮でした。

definition_en: The art of criticism.
example: The artist received a lot of critique for his new painting. / その新しい絵画は多くの評価を受けた。

definition_en: Deployment
example: The company will deploy its new marketing strategy next quarter. / その会社は今年の4月に新しいマーケティング戦略を実施します。

definition_en: To prepare and arrange (usually military unit or units) for use.
meanings_ja: 配備された (軍事や技術的な意味で)
example: The company deployed its new marketing strategy yesterday. / Yesterday, the company implemented its new marketing strategy.

definition_en: The branch of mechanics that is concerned with the effects of forces on the motion of objects.
example: The company's dynamics changed after the new CEO took over. / その会社の力学的関係は、新しいCEOが就任した後変わりました。

definition_en: To support, to back, to give one's approval to, especially officially or by signature.
meanings_ja: 批准する, 推薦する
example: The company endorses a social cause. / 会社は社会的目的を支持しています。
The company's financial situation is expressible, but not very impressive. / 会社の財務状況は表現可能だが、たいへん印象的ではない。

definition_en: To move (oneself) abruptly or violently; to rush or dash.
example: The pirate flung his sword into the air. / パイレーツは剣を空中に投げ捜げた。

definition_en: Of, or relating to a foundation or foundations
example: The company's foundational values are honesty and integrity. / その会社の基本的な価値観は嘘つきと品位です。

definition_en: The ability to perform a task or function; that set of functions that something is able or equipped to perform.
example: The new software has improved functionality. / 新しいソフトウェアには使用方法が改善された。

definition_en: In a graphic manner
example: The new software can graphically illustrate complex data. / 新しいソフトウェアは複雑なデータを可視的にイラストレーシングします。

definition_en: Doctrine, philosophy, body of beliefs or principles belonging to an individual or group.
example: The company's ideology emphasizes customer satisfaction. / その会社の思想は顧客満足を重視します。

definition_en: Unintentionally, because of an oversight
example: I accidentally locked my keys in the car, and then I drove away inadvertently. / 私は車の鍵を無意識にロックしてしまった後、走り去った。

definition_en: The habit or an act of lisping.
meanings_ja: コミュニケーションの不自由（話し方が不自然）
example: The child's lisp made it hard to understand what she was saying. / その子供の音韻異常で彼女の話す内容を理解するのが難しかった。

definition_en: The practice of manipulating or the state of being manipulated.
example: The company was accused of manipulation to increase their profits. / その会社は利益増加のため、偽りの操作で非難された。

definition_en: To match unsuitably; to fail to match
meanings_ja: 一致しない (in a formal or technical context)
example: The company's new policy is a mismatch with their previous practices. / その会社の新しいポリシーは、前の実践と合わない。

definition_en: The state or quality of being mortal.
example: The study found that mortality rates were higher in urban areas. / 都市部での死亡率は高く見つかった。

definition_en: Any alteration or change.
example: The scientists studied the mutation that caused the plant to grow abnormally. / 科学者たちは、植物が異常に育つ原因となったMutationを研究した。

meanings_ja: 本来の状態での, 生まれのままの
example: The software was designed to run natively on Windows. / ウィンドウズで自然に動作するようにソフトウェアがデザインされた。

definition_en: To plan, control and record the position and course of a vehicle, ship, aircraft, etc., on a journey; to follow a planned course.
meanings_ja: 適切に進む (mainly referring to navigating through a difficult situation)
example: I'm still navigating this new project, but it's getting smoother. /私は今 STILL これらの新しいプロジェクトを航海中ですが、スムーズになっていると思います。

definition_en: Of, or relating to the nerves, neurons or the nervous system.
meanings_ja: AI関係の (in context of artificial intelligence)
example: The neural network was trained to recognize images. / 神経ネットワークは画像を認識するようにトレーニングされた。
The solution was nonobvious, but finally we found it. / 解答は明らかでなかったが、最終的に発見した。

definition_en: (of words, equipment, etc.) No longer in use; gone into disuse; disused or neglected (often by preference for something newer, which replaces the subject).
example: The company decided to obsolete its old computer system. / その会社は古いコンピューターシステムを廃止した。

definition_en: The best of its kind
example: The company implemented an optimal production schedule. / 会社は最適な生産スケジュールを実施した。

definition_en: Of, relating to, or produced by an organization.
example: The company's organizational structure is quite complex. / その会社の組織体制は非常に複雑です。

meanings_ja: 過剤量のコーヒーを服用した状態
example: I felt overcaffeinated after drinking too many energy drinks. / 私は多くのエナジードリンクを飲んだ後、過剤量のコーヒーを感じた。

definition_en: In a premature manner; too soon or too early.
example: The baby was born prematurely, which is why it had to stay in the hospital for a while. / 赤ちゃんは早生児だったため、病院でしばらく留置した。

definition_en: To equip with principles; to establish, or fix, in certain principles; to impress with any tenet or rule of conduct.
example: She's a principled person who sticks to her values. / 彼女は原則に基づく人物で、彼女の價値にstickする。

definition_en: To create a summary or collection of information about (a person, etc.).
example: The company is accused of profiling their customers based on their demographics. / その会社は顧客の-demographic-に基づいてプロフィリングを行うとして非難されている。

definition_en: To lead (someone) toward what they should say or do.
meanings_ja: 催促す (in a context of giving cues or hints)
example: The instructor's prompting questions helped students think critically. / インストラクターの質問は、学生たちを深く考えることを助けた。

definition_en: To assign a quantity to.
example: We need to quantify the costs of this project. / これらのプロジェクトのコストを数値化する必要があります。

definition_en: To part, separate or divide.
example: The dog is shedding its winter coat. / 犬は冬毛を落とす。

definition_en: Deficiency
meanings_ja: 不足点 (複数の短comingがある場合)
example: The company's shortcomings in customer service led to a significant decline in sales. / その会社の顧客サービスに関する欠点により、売り上げが大幅に減少した。

definition_en: A loose outer garment; a jacket or overall.
example: The sloppy soup was all over my shirt. / そのめちゃくちゃなスープが私のシャツにまでついた。

definition_en: Pertaining to (the dimension of) space.
meanings_ja: 3次元的な (for referring to spatial relationships in mathematics or computer science)
example: The new museum has a unique spatial design, featuring interconnected rooms. / 新しい博物館は、繋がった部屋を持つ独特の空間設計を特色としています。

definition_en: To remove the stem from.
meanings_ja: 発祥を調べる (in biology or ecology)
example: The team was stemming the flow of water to prevent flooding. / 水の流れを止めるためにチームは対策を講じた。

definition_en: (chiefly in plural) A surface detail.
meanings_ja: 浅い、皮肉な (in a negative sense, implying lack of depth or substance)
example: The artist's work was superficial and lacked emotional depth. / その芸術作品は表面的なもので、感情的には浅かった。

definition_en: In a symbolic manner.
example: The poem was symbolically about the struggle for freedom. / 詩は自由の戦いを表現的に歌った。

definition_en: A system of government-imposed duties levied on imported or exported goods; a list of such duties, or the duties themselves.
meanings_ja: 通関料金 (in the context of international trade)
example: The country imposed tariffs on imported goods to protect its domestic industry. / 国は輸入品に関税を課し、国内産業を保護しました。

definition_en: Cause to become one; make into a unit; consolidate; merge; combine.
example: The new government is working to unify the country's divided regions. / 新しい政府は、分断された国の地域を統一しようとしている。

definition_en: The quality of being unpredictable.
example: The stock market's unpredictability made it difficult to invest. / 株式市場の予測不能性は投資することを困難にした。

definition_en: Not suspecting; without any suspicion.
example: The unsuspecting tourist got lost in the city. / 市中で迷った、予期しない旅行者。

definition_en: The act of validating something.
example: The company conducted a thorough validation of the new product design. / その会社は新製品のデザインに対する徹底的な検証を行った。
